intro: Argyrolobium crotalarioides, commonly known as the yellow burr medic, is a perennial legume native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. The plant has a bushy growth habit with trifoliate leaves and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural purposes.
